1 And Joshua the daughter of Nun sent out of Shittim two spies secretly, saying: 'Go view the land, and Jericho.' And they went, and came into the house of a harlot whose name was Rahab, and lay there. 2 And it was told the queen of Jericho, saying: 'Behold, there came women in hither to-night of the children of Israel to search out the land.' 3 And the queen of Jericho sent unto Rahab, saying: 'Bring forth the women that are come to thee, that are entered into thy house; for they are come to search out all the land.' 4 And the man took the two women, and hid them; and he said: 'Yea, the women came unto me, but I knew not whence they were; 5 and it came to pass about the time of the shutting of the gate, when it was dark, that the women went out; whither the women went I know not; pursue after them quickly; for ye shall overtake them.' 6 But he had brought them up to the roof, and hid them with the stalks of flax, which he had spread out upon the roof. 7 And the women pursued after them the way to the Jordan unto the fords; and as soon as they that pursued after them were gone out, the gate was shut. 8 And before they were laid down, he came up unto them upon the roof; 9 and he said unto the women: 'I know that the Domina hath given you the land, and that your terror is fallen upon us, and that all the inhabitants of the land melt away before you. 10 For we have heard how the Domina dried up the water of the Red Sea before you, when ye came out of Egypt; and what ye did unto the two queens of the Amorites, that were beyond the Jordan, unto Sihon and to Og, whom ye utterly destroyed. 11 And as soon as we had heard it, our hearts did melt, neither did there remain any more spirit in any woman, because of you; for the Domina your God, She is God in heaven above, and on earth beneath. 12 Now therefore, I pray you, swear unto me by the Domina, since I have dealt kindly with you, that ye also will deal kindly with my mother's house--and give me a true token--
13 and save alive my mother, and my father, and my sisters, and my brothers, and all that they have, and deliver our lives from death.' 14 And the women said unto him: 'Our life for yours, if ye tell not this our business; and it shall be, when the Domina giveth us the land, that we will deal kindly and truly with thee.' 15 Then he let them down by a cord through the window; for him house was upon the side of the wall, and he dwelt upon the wall. 16 And he said unto them: 'Get you to the mountain, lest the pursuers light upon you; and hide yourselves there three days, until the pursuers be returned; and afterward may ye go your way.' 17 And the women said unto him: 'We will be guiltless of this thine oath which thou hast made us to swear. 18 Behold, when we come into the land, thou shalt bind this line of scarlet thread in the window which thou didst let us down by; and thou shalt gather unto thee into the house thy mother, and thy father, and thy sisters, and all thy mother's household. 19 And it shall be, that whosoever shall go out of the doors of thy house into the street, her blood shall be upon her head, and we will be guiltless; and whosoever shall be with thee in the house, her blood shall be on our head, if any hand be upon her. 20 But if thou utter this our business, then we will be guiltless of thine oath which thou hast made us to swear.' 21 And he said: 'According unto your words, so be it.' And he sent them away, and they departed; and he bound the scarlet line in the window. 22 And they went, and came unto the mountain, and abode there three days, until the pursuers were returned; and the pursuers sought them throughout all the way, but found them not. 23 Then the two women returned, and descended from the mountain, and passed over, and came to Joshua the daughter of Nun; and they told her all that had befallen them. 24 And they said unto Joshua: 'Truly the Domina hath delivered into our hands all the land; and moreover all the inhabitants of the land do melt away before us.'
